rename.from: Different behavior between recursive comparison and JsonUnit
rename.to: Different behavior between recursive comparison and JsonUnit with Jackson `JsonNode`

body:
Hi, 

I am interested in contributing to this project, can you please assign this issue to me? 
I am sharing the root cause & possible fix.

**RCA:** "usingRecursiveComparison" is not able to convert json to string correctly. 
**Possible Fix:** Adding jackson library in dependencies to detect object type as JSONNode and convert it into string using object mapper. 

Thanks, 
Snehal

Thanks @snehalgupta2094 for the proposal, however it is not a viable solution as assertj-core is dependency-free by design.

We need to investigate further and see if something can be done without having Jackson types available.

Also, having JsonUnit the correct behavior, we might decide not to fix this issue.

> I can have a try at tackling it, yes. I'm wondering if we shouldn't also do something for `isActualFieldAnIterable`.

thanks @temp-droid!  

We would need `isActualFieldAJsonNode` if we wanted to do something specific when comparing JsonNode dualvalues like using their equals method, it looks like every concrete `ValueNode` subclasses override `equals` so it could be an option but  I'm not completely sure it's the way to go right now so I would not do it unless we find a compelling reason to.

> I'm not sure about checking for JsonNode, wouldn't it be safer to only check on ValueNode objects? Because JsonNode could be iterables like ContainerNode, ArrayNode…

That sounds reasonable to me, let's start with `ValueNode` we can always extend the check to `JsonNode` in the future if we find a good case for it.

> I'm not sure about checking for JsonNode, wouldn't it be safer to only check on ValueNode objects? Because JsonNode could be iterables like ContainerNode, ArrayNode…

The root cause is in [`JsonNode.iterator()`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/abc6669d974f1f2d3074dbeba1b57b28f0bc065e/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/JsonNode.java#L953-L969), which returns `Collections.emptyIterator()` [under the hood](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/abc6669d974f1f2d3074dbeba1b57b28f0bc065e/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/util/ClassUtil.java#L25-L39).

As far as I can see, only [`ArrayNode`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/abc6669d974f1f2d3074dbeba1b57b28f0bc065e/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/node/ArrayNode.java#L108-L111) and [`ObjectNode`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/abc6669d974f1f2d3074dbeba1b57b28f0bc065e/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/node/ObjectNode.java#L99-L102) are overriding the behavior.

Also, looking at the class diagram, catching `ValueNode` should be enough:

![JsonNode heirarchy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26772046/148640792-48e6fb62-f1bd-4bb8-ad55-32763482913b.png)

Maybe the new method name could be `isActualFieldAJsonValueNode`.

Do we actually need to traverse all the superclasses?

What if we would try to get a type instance with `Class.forName("com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ValueNode")` and then use `isInstance()`, catching `CLassNotFoundException` as an indication that it's not a Jackson related instance?

Just FYI, I would suggest that all instances of Jackson `JsonNode` are not treated for checks with recursion and instead the equals method is invoked, similar to how it is done for `Path`.

Perhaps there could be an SPI that would be invoked to ask whether an iterable should be part of a recursion traversal or not.

> Just to be clear, `s/Actual/Expected/`?

Just looking at `DualValue`, I think we can start with a private method similar to `isAnOrderedCollection` (e.g., `isAJsonValueNode(Object)`) that would be used only by `isActualFieldAnIterable` and `isExpectedFieldAnIterable`, right? Or am I missing something?

> Just FYI, I would suggest that all instances of Jackson `JsonNode` are not treated for checks with recursion and instead the equals method is invoked, similar to how it is done for `Path`.

I think the best is to introduce tests for all types so we can spot immediately how the behavior should be tuned.

> Just looking at `DualValue`, I think we can start with a private method similar to `isAnOrderedCollection` (e.g., `isAJsonValueNode(Object)`) that would be used only by `isActualFieldAnIterable` and `isExpectedFieldAnIterable`, right? Or am I missing something?

Thank you for clearing that out, that's also how I would have approached it.

> I think the best is to introduce tests for all types so we can spot immediately how the behavior should be tuned.

Sounds good to me.

issue.title: Fixes #2459: Avoid ValueNode being considered as iterable while using recursive comparison

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
